intro: Osteospermum rigidum, commonly known as the rigid osteospermum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white to pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, rigid stems. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Osteospermum rigidum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
